stories.text:
A common mistake I see more and more people do is to build websites using React and Vue.js. These frameworks are meant to build web apps, they provide no advantage if you want to build a content website, worse they will kill all your SEO efforts. Having done a lot of SEO research in the past year, I came to the conclusion that search engines heavily penalize React and Vue.js websites even when they use server side rendering and I think they do this rightfully.

If I am looking for some kind of information, I want to have it right away, with spending as little bandwidth as possible and certainly I don't want to start a web app with over 1mb of javascript.

To summarize:

- Where React or Vue.js are a good choice: Web Apps that you don't want to be indexed by search engines. Such as SaaS tools or administration interfaces.

- Where you shouldn't use React or Vue.js: Content websites with little dynamic functionalities that you want to be indexed on search engines.
stories.title: React and Vue.js are meant to build web apps, not websites

stories.text:
Looking for some advice here -

I'm a non-technical jack-of-all-trades who can handle marketing, design, sales, etc. A few months ago, I approached a friend who's quite strong as a developer to collaborate on a side project that has positive feedback from the early user research I've done. We agreed to split equity evenly.

However, they have not contributed over the last few months (no line of code started), despite me checking in and reporting my progress. When I ask, they say they are busy with work, which is understandable as we both have full-time jobs in tech. However, last week when I ask them if they were still interested continuing at all, they insisted that they were but simply couldn't find the time.

What gives? I'd rather them tell me upfront if they weren't interested in continuing, instead of dragging out for who knows how long. I'm also tired of checking in every few weeks with no updates.

Any advice for how I should handle this situation?
stories.title: Developer friend not contributing to side project
